columns.dc:description: The name of the organisation to which the dataset relates.
A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) which identifies the organisation.
Date at which the information provided is true, in the ISO international date format YYYY-MM-DD.
Street name and area where the car park is located.
Postcode where the car park is located.
The number of parking spaces available within the car park.
The number of parking spaces specifically marked out as a disabled parking bay.
Information relating to the terms of use of the car park e.g. time limits, applicable charges etc.
TRUE or FALSE indicating whether parking is available free of charge (subject to the terms mentioned in ParkingRestrictions).
TRUE or FALSE indicating whether parking is subject to a charge (subject to the terms mentioned in ParkingRestrictions).
TRUE or FALSE indicating whether there is a height restriction in force.

Height restriction (if applicable) in metres expressed as a number to 2 decimal places, e.g. 1.98 and is approximately derived from the HeightRestrictionFeet value. Zero value indicates no height restriction.
Height restriction (if applicable) in feet expressed as a number to 1 decimal place e.g. 6.5 is 6 and a half feet, or 6 feet 6 inches. Zero value indicates no height restriction.
TRUE or FALSE indicating whether there are charging points for electric vehicles.

TRUE or FALSE indicating whether the car park has been awarded a Park Mark, a Police Crime Prevention Initiative (Police-CPI) aimed at reducing both crime and the fear of crime in parking facilities. More information is available at https://www.parkmark.co.uk/.
